title: Advice for leaving Bronze 5 when all 4 teamates are bad every game?
body:
My friend who is good (the Best Thresh) isn't on much.

When I play ranked solo que I have the problem of having 4 bad teamates every game.

How can I fix that?

Why are all 4 bad every game I play?

Why aren't they ever bad on the enemy team?

You might be thinking I'm the bad one....

Nope I'm pretty sure I'm the best Fiora in all of leauges (Or I was before Riot nerfed my champ for being so good)

I'm still good.

No more level 1 pentakills and 40 and 0 scores but I get like 40 and 7.

So why do I always get bad teamates?

I can't carry solo anymore after Riot nerfed my main.

I can't 1vs4 and 1vs5 all game when my team is dead.

How can I even get ahead in ranked if my team never pushes with me and feeds random areas of the map never grouping?

How can I even get ahead in ranked if they surrender every game and afk every game?

How can I carry a rage quitter every game with a nerfed champ?

Any advice?

replies.body:
If you really are a good player stuck in bronze.

1. Win your lane, really hard.
2. Take their turret, shove the lane up.
3. Rotate to another lane, win that lane too. Gank someone and take dragon or another turret.
4. Ward up their jungle and take their jungle camps.
5. Use lots of pings and alert your team of what objectives you're taking next.

Now of course you will not win every game like this. Sometimes your team just feeds too hard, but if you really deserve to climb you *will* gradually climb.

Remember, you've got 4 useless bronze 5 players on your team, but the *enemy* has *five* useless bronze 5 players on their team. That means if you are not also a bronze 5 player your team will have an unfair advantage in every single match.

Assuming this is not a troll thread , which it probably is;
1- The absolute best advice I can give a bronze player is , and I hate saying it using this nomenclature.... don't "Tilt". The vast majority of low level games are lost because people quickly lose their cool, stay cool in every match and this will drastically increase your chances of winning.

2- Avoid chat conflict with your teammates. Relates to #1.

3- Ideally play jungler or mid, take advantage of the fact that enemy players are complete garbo with atrocious positioning and almost zero map awareness. A ganking jungler will obliterate low ranked games so easily... I was playing my alt account awhile back (Bronze 5) and I got it to Silver 5 by sporadically playing it, winning almost every game  as {{champion:1}}  {{champion:28}}  etc.
http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=solitium

4- This is important but will occur gradually as long as you recognize your mistakes;
Improve your personal mechanics, improve your timing and map awareness. 

etc.

1) **Farm**. Get better at CSing. Push your lane out before you go roaming.

2) Win lane then help the rest of the map. If you're winning your lane and your bot lane is losing, for example, then maybe try TP ganking bot or roaming there. A successful TP gank can get your bot lane back into the ame and can also help un-tilt them a bit.

3) Always, **always** be positive. People tilt so hard and so easily. Be positive. Reminding your 0/3 team mate that they're playing like shit is going to make them play even worse. There is absolutely nothing to gain from flaming your team mates.

4) Remember when I said that people tilt so easily? Well that can be used to your advantage. You can tilt the enemy team on purpose. Play some mind games. Some might say spamming mastery badges after getting a kill is BMing, but its not and you wont get banned for it. Do it. Tilt the enemy and make them play worse. Spam laugh. Spam taunt. Spam mastery. **Do not** straight up BM in all-chat.
